definitions.definition: To clothe with, or as with, a vestment, or garment; to dress; to robe; to cover, surround, or encompass closely.
To clothe with authority, power, etc.; to put in possession; to invest; to furnish; to endow; followed by with and the thing conferred.
examples: to vest a court with power to try cases of life and death

definitions.definition: To place or give into the possession or discretion of some person or authority; to commit to another; with in before the possessor.
examples: The power of life and death is vested in the king, or in the courts.

definitions.definition: To clothe with possession; also, to give a person an immediate fixed right of present or future enjoyment of.
examples: to vest a person with an estate
an estate is vested in possession

definitions.definition: To devolve upon the person currently entitled when a prior interest has ended.
examples: Upon the death of the Sovereign the Crown automatically vests in the next heir without the need of coronation or other formality.
labels: of an inheritance or a trust fund
label_groups: of an inheritance or a trust fund

definitions.definition: To become vested , to become permanent .
examples: My pension vests at the end of the month and then I can take it with me when I quit.
to vest money in goods, land, or houses

main_definition: ( chiefly passive ) To clothe with, or as with, a vestment, or garment; to dress; to robe; to cover, surround, or encompass closely.
secondary_definitions: To clothe with authority, power, etc.; to put in possession; to invest; to furnish; to endow; followed by with and the thing conferred.
To place or give into the possession or discretion of some person or authority; to commit to another; with in before the possessor.
( law ) To clothe with possession; also, to give a person an immediate fixed right of present or future enjoyment of.
( law , intransitive ) (of an inheritance or a trust fund) To devolve upon the person currently entitled when a prior interest has ended.
( finance , intransitive ) To become vested , to become permanent .
